location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'Near the big mosque, Bagdad' Photographer: Wilfrid Malleson

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:151 x 188 mmCondition:The print is in good condition with minor surface dirt throughout.Foliation:‘37’

mods.abstract: Genre/Subject Matter:The title may refer to the mosque of Shaikh Abd al-Qadir al-Jilani, in which Al Gilani’s tomb is situated. Two large domes, one of which is clearly very ornate, are visible in the background at right; a minaret appears to be located behind the decorated dome.In the middle-ground two adults, a dog and a group of children stand beside houses that extend from left to centre. A further dog and woman are visible in the background at right. The buildings at left are brick two-storeyed structures with wooden mashrabiyyas projecting towards the open area at right and in the foreground.Inscriptions:Ink, below image: 'Near the big mosque, Bagdad'
